intro: Palicourea crocea var. riparia, commonly known as riparian palicourea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves. Its small, fragrant flowers are typically white or pale pink and are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments along riverbanks and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
